wikipedia_page.main: Tina Gharavi (Persian: تینا غروی) is an Iranian-born British BAFTA and Sundance nominated artist, director and screenwriter.

response: In 2008, South Shields resident and filmmaker Tina Gharavi unveiled plans for a plaque to mark Ali's visit.

link_mentions.page: List of female film and television directors

response: Partially as a result of funding from the UK Film Council (disbanded in 2010), a new generation of British female filmmakers has emerged in the 21st-century, including Penny Woolcock, Carol Morley, Joanna Hogg, Clio Barnard, Sally El Hosaini, Amma Asante, and Tina Gharavi. Gallery artists Gillian Wearing and Sam Taylor-Wood have both moved into feature cinema, with Taylor-Wood (now Taylor-Johnson) named as director of the adaptation of Fifty Shades of Grey.
*Tina Gharavi, filmmaker, 1998, set up Bridge and Tunnel Productions, filmed Closer (2000); Mother/Country (2002)

link_mentions.page: BAFTA Award for Outstanding Debut by a British Writer, Director or Producer

response: First Cut was initially a strand of thirty half-hour primetime documentaries commissioned by Channel 4 Commissioning Editor for Documentaries, Sarah Mulvey. It was added to the schedule to replace the old Alt-TV show, which launched many documentary makers' careers including Marc Isaacs, Olly Lambert, Emily James, Tina Gharavi, Paul Berczeller and Morgan Matthew. First Cut aimed to access the brightest and best new talent, allowing young directors to showcase their talent before being given further opportunities on Channel 4's flagship documentaries Cutting Edge and Dispatches.
Opening Film: I Am Nasrine (2011)http://www.screendaily.com/i-am-nasrine-to-world-premiere-at-berwick-film-festival/5032286.article by Tina Gharavi.
|| Director: Tina Gharavi   Cast: Micsha Sadeghi, Shiraz Haq, Christian Coulson

In addition, Mohsen's decision to present the film at the Jerusalem Film Festival in contravention of the BDS campaign caused some controversy. An open letter published on Jadaliyya urging him not to attend was signed by many prominent Iranians, including Arash Bineshpajouh, Tina Gharavi, Ziba Mir-Hosseini, Laleh Khalili, Hamid Dabashi, Fatemeh Keshavarz, Ervand Abrahamian, and Asef Bayat. The letter was also critical of Iran's state-sponsored oppression of the Baha’i community.

I Am Nasrine ()  is a 2012 British-Iranian drama film written and directed by Tina Gharavi. The film was nominated at the 66th British Academy Film Awards for Outstanding Debut by a British Writer, Director or Producer.
* Tina Gharavi (Outstanding Debut by a British Writer, Director or Producer) – I Am Nasrine
